1610255135_1LWUniEdUPZrEqFD3Yj9tpqkQNnfs.body:
The world wide web started distributed. Everyone had to run their own server in order to put their own content and ideas into it.

Because that took too much effort and was inconvenient, hosting and the internet started getting more and more centralized. People and later businesses began giving up the control of their own content to big tech, because of that. And now they suddenly start complaining about that, when big tech companies do thinks they don't like.

Parler choose to depend on Amazon, Google, Apple and others with their business, so they now have to deal with the consequences.

> [mfs](#comment_78_1B8Nj3YZQSgw2aqhrHof5w73RpP6Xk2a7W): To be fair, GAB did the same thing but fought back.

GAB is based on mastodon, so it has proper federation and therefore will be much harder to take down.
